title: Allies Fear US Is Overextended as Global Conflicts Spread
description: Joe Biden came to office declaring America is back. Now, facing hot wars in the Middle East and Ukraine and a simmering cold one with China, the US is beginning to look overextended.

title: Iran Warns of ‘New Fronts’ Against the US If Hamas War Continues
description: Iran’s foreign minister warned that new fronts would open against the US if it keeps up unequivocal support for Israel, and said Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s government would regret its actions if it proceeds with a full-scale invasion.

title: New Speaker Johnson Has a Pile-Up of Challenges Waiting for Him
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, congressional reporter Steven T. Dennis takes a look at the tasks ahead for the new House speaker . Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.

title: Ukraine, Israel Pose Early Tests for New House Speaker Mike Johnson
description: Newly installed Speaker Mike Johnson confronts critical early tests with an emergency aid request for Ukraine and Israel and a mid-November funding deadline to keep open the US government — all made more difficult by House Republicans’ ideological divide.

title: Dean Phillips Makes Long-Shot White House Bid Against Biden
description: Representative Dean Phillips said he would challenge President Joe Biden for the Democratic nomination, seizing on worries about the economy and Biden’s age.

title: Biden Urges ‘Open Lines’ in Meeting With China’s Foreign Minister
description: President Joe Biden stressed the importance of managing competition and maintaining lines of communication between the world’s two largest economies during a meeting Friday with China’s foreign minister, Wang Yi, according to the White House.

title: Hurricane Disaster in Mexico Spurs Criticism of AMLO Response
description: As an iconic Mexican resort lay devastated by a surprise hurricane, the country’s president was, quite literally, stuck in the mud.

title: Boris Johnson Promises ‘Unvarnished Views’ in New Job at GB News
description: Boris Johnson promised to deliver his “unvarnished views” as the former UK prime minister takes up a new position at the GB News channel.

title: Starmer Under Pressure as UK Labour Figures Urge Gaza Ceasefire
description: Three senior Labour politicians called for a ceasefire between Israel and Hamas to allow humanitarian aid to reach Gaza, interventions that will add to pressure on leader Keir Starmer to shift his stance on the conflict.

title: El Salvador President Nayib Bukele Registers for Reelection
description: El Salvador President Nayib Bukele registered as a candidate with the country’s electoral authority on Thursday night for February’s presidential election.

title: George Santos Pleads Not Guilty to New Campaign Finance Charges
description: US Representative George Santos, who allegedly fabricated much of his life story before he was elected to Congress, pleaded not guilty to the latest charges filed against him by federal prosecutors.

title: Canada Plans College Crackdown After Foreign Student Criticism
description: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau’s government is planning new measures to tighten standards on colleges, responding to criticism that Canada’s education sector is bringing in so many foreign students that it’s boosting pressure on housing and the labor market.

title: Ivanka Trump Must Testify in Father’s NY Civil Trial, Judge Says
description: A New York judge ordered Donald Trump’s daughter Ivanka Trump to testify at the ongoing trial of the state’s $250 million civil fraud lawsuit against the former president and his sprawling real estate company.

title: Uruguayans Pile Into Argentina to Spend Record $1 Billion
description: Uruguayans have spent a record amount in Argentina so far this year with the tab near $1 billion, taking advantage of a deep economic crisis that’s left food, vacations and shopping costing a fraction of the price back home.

title: DeSantis Says China Creates Conflict by Propping Up Russia and Iran
description: Florida Governor Ron DeSantis focused on the challenge presented by China in a foreign policy address, saying the country posed a “formidable threat” to the US and accusing Beijing of contributing to global instability through its economic links to Russia and Iran.

title: Hungary and Serbia Feeding Putin’s “War Machine,” Bulgaria Says
description: Bulgaria’s leader accused Hungary and Serbia of helping feed the Kremlin’s “war machine” by failing to seek alternative energy supplies in an escalating row over a gas-import tax.

title: Nikki Haley’s Foreign Policy Savvy Props Up Her Long-Shot Presidential Bid
description: Rising international tensions are giving new life to Republican Nikki Haley’s presidential campaign — but so far it hasn’t been enough to vault her past her onetime boss, Donald Trump.

title: Zimbabwe Extends US Dollar Use By Five Years to 2030
description: Zimbabwean President Emmerson Mnangagwa has approved the use of US dollars as legal tender until 2030.

title: Stanford Slammed by Global Alumni, Students for Hamas Response
description: Stanford University leadership is coming under increasing criticism for failing to clearly condemn the Hamas attacks on Israel and recent acts of antisemitism on campus.

title: Oil Lobby Urges South Africa to Finalize New Hydrocarbon Law
description: A South African oil and gas industry lobby is pushing for the finalization of new legislation that will provide greater certainty for explorers and producers, as activists step up pressure to curtail the use of fossil fuels.

title: The Business of Children’s Books in This New Era of Book Banning
description: As the publishing industry reels from a spate of recent bans—the majority of which affect kids—schools and libraries are providing some hope.

title: India Likely to Appeal Qatar Death Sentence for Eight in Spy Case
description: New Delhi is considering appealing the death sentence handed down to eight former Indian navy staff in Qatar, according to people familiar with the matter, in a case that’s shocked the government and prompted an outpouring of concern.

title: India, UK See Trade Deal Possibly in December After Poll Results
description: India and the UK don’t expect a free trade agreement to be announced until after state elections in the South Asian nation are completed in December, according to people with knowledge of the matter.

title: Not Calling For a Ceasefire: Labour Struggles on Israel & Gaza
description: Get caught up on the day’s political news

title: How 2024 Swing-State Voters Feel About the US Economy — In 10 Charts
description: Voters in Arizona, Georgia, Michigan, Nevada, North Carolina, Pennsylvania and Wisconsin are concerned about the US economy ahead of the 2024 election, where President Joe Biden faces a likely-rematch against former president Donald Trump.

title: Water Fights in US West Inspire New Judge Training
description: Officials in Colorado, Utah and Nevada are teaching judges how to handle the growing number cases over water rights.

title: China’s Top Infectious Diseases Expert, Who Played Key Role in Zero-Covid, Dies
description: BEIJING (AP) — Wu Zunyou, China’s top infectious diseases expert who played a key role in the zero-COVID strategy, has died.

title: Xi Faces ‘Delicate Political Moment’ in Handling Grief Over Li
description: The sudden death of ex-Premier Li Keqiang has handed his old boss Xi Jinping fresh risks, as an outpouring of emotion for a popular reformer risks spilling into discontent over a slowing economy.

title: World Leaders Pay Tribute to Li Keqiang for Vision and Sincerity
description: World leaders including Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese and Indonesian President Joko Widodo expressed condolences over the death of China’s former Premier Li Keqiang, with some politicians reflecting on his candor and modesty.

title: Lagarde Urges EU Chiefs to Agree Fiscal Pact for Sake of Unity
description: European Central Bank President Christine Lagarde urged European Union leaders to come to an agreement on their fiscal rules before the end of the year.

title: Scholz Warns EU Leaders It’s Time for Tough Spending Choices
description: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz warned European Union leaders in a tense, closed-door meeting that it’s time to get serious about limiting the bloc’s spending plans as many push for new funding to help Ukraine and address migration.

title: Li Keqiang: Late China Premier Championed Growth, Small Business
description: The late Chinese Premier Li Keqiang built his reputation around trying to make economic growth the Communist Party’s number one priority, with the expansion of private businesses and innovation as the main tools for achieving that.

title: Milei Support Opens Deep Crack in Argentina’s Opposition Coalition
description: Argentina’s business-friendly opposition faces a damaging breakup as its leadership splits over outsider Javier Milei’s bid for president, a dramatic moment that threatens to reshape the country’s politics for years to come.

title: US Deploys Fresh Sanctions Targeting Hamas’ Fundraising Efforts
description: The US on Friday imposed new sanctions intended to cut off financing to Hamas, nearly three weeks after the militant group’s assault on Israel from the Gaza Strip.

title: Another Global Crisis Brews in the South China Sea
description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.

title: Wall Street Worries About Losing Texas Deals Over Ken Paxton’s Green Energy Probe
description: Texas Attorney General Ken Paxton is sending shock waves through the state’s booming municipal-bond market, leaving borrowers and bankers alike on edge.

title: Expats in Netherlands Face Higher Taxes After House Votes to Shrink Benefit
description: The Dutch parliament approved a proposal to cut a benefit that exempts 30% of an expat’s salary from income tax for five years.

title: Saudi Arabia Seeks Trade Deals, Mulls BRICS Offer to Lift Exports
description: Saudi Arabia is looking to sign more free trade agreements and still considering joining the BRICS club of emerging nations, as it looks to boost non-oil exports, according to the kingdom’s minister of economy and planning.

title: Huawei’s Profit Doubles With Made-in-China Chip Breakthrough
description: Huawei Technologies Co.’s profit more than doubled during the quarter it revealed its biggest achievement in chip technology, adding to signs the Chinese tech leader is steadying a business rocked by US sanctions.

title: In Photos: A Look Back at the Rise and Fall of Li Keqiang’s Political Career
description: A rising star in the Communist Party, Li Keqiang saw his influence diminished as Xi tightened his grip on the government, with the role of premiership losing power in both political stature and direct authority.

title: China Civil Service Sees Record Job Seekers as Stability Beckons
description: A record number of Chinese job seekers are looking for a job in the national civil service, as many seek stability amid a grim labor market in the world’s No. 2 economy.

title: Thaksin’s Daughter Takes Helm of Thailand’s Ruling Party
description: Paetongtarn Shinawatra, daughter of former Thai premier Thaksin Shinawatra, was elected as the new leader of the party that heads the nation’s ruling coalition, cementing her family’s grip on power following a general election earlier this year.

title: Ukraine Recap: China Likely to Skip Malta Peace-Formula Meeting
description: China isn’t expected to join a meeting in Malta this weekend where national security officials from more than 55 nations will discuss Ukraine’s drive to build support for its so-called 10-point peace formula. Beijing’s absence would be a blow to Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy.

title: Philippines Drops China Railway Deals, Seeks Other Funders
description: The Philippines will no longer pursue Chinese loans to fund three railway projects valued at more than $5 billion and has started discussions with other Asian countries for alternative financing deals.

title: Israel Latest: Troops Enter Gaza Once Again for Limited Raid
description: Israel said it sent troops on a limited raid into Gaza for the second night running, as preparations for a more extensive ground offensive continue.

title: Taiwan Parties Push Alliance Talks in Bid to Beat Ruling DPP
description: Taiwan People’s Party leader Ko Wen-je, running second in most polls ahead of January’s presidential election, said there have been multiple meetings with the Kuomintang on a potential alliance against the frontrunner, the ruling Democratic Progressive Party.

title: Maine Lifts Shelter-in-Place Order as Manhunt Continues
description: LEWISTON, Maine (AP) — Authorities scoured the woods and hundreds of acres of family-owned property, sent dive teams with sonar to the bottom of a river and scrutinized a possible suicide note Friday in the second day of their intensive search for an Army reservist accused of fatally shooting 18 people and wounding 13 at a bowling alley and a bar in Maine.

title: Race to Fix Crumbling Ship Threatens Conflict in South China Sea
description: Even as concerns mount in the US over a possible Chinese invasion of Taiwan, the flashpoint most likely to spark a conflict between the world’s largest economies is currently an immobile World War II-era ship sitting in waters further to the south.

title: House Will Consider Ukraine, Israel Aid Separately, Johnson Says
description: The House of Representatives will consider new military assistance for Ukraine and Israel as separate measures, the newly installed speaker said Thursday, complicating President Joe Biden’s attempts to secure support for both US allies.

title: US Military Attacks Two Syrian Facilities It Says Linked to Iran
description: US forces conducted strikes on two facilities in eastern Syria it believes were used by Iran’s Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps and affiliated groups, in response to attacks on American troops in the region.

title: India Ramps Up Border Drone Defense After Hamas Attack on Israel
description: India is setting up a surveillance system with drones across its borders to wade off surprise attacks like the one from Hamas in Israel, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: China Isn’t ‘Status-Quo Power,’ Aussie PM Albanese Tells US State Department
description: China is seeking to refashion the global order into a system more pliant to its interests in the Asia-Pacific and world, Australia’s prime minister said, urging leading democracies to protect the foundations of their security and prosperity.

title: G-7 Trade Chiefs Set to Tackle Supply Chains, Economic Coercion
description: Trade ministers from the world’s most advanced economies will seek strategies to make global supply chains more resilient and governments less vulnerable to economic coercion from the likes of China when they gather in Osaka this weekend.

title: China Former Premier Li Keqiang Dies of Heart Attack at Age 68
description: China’s former Premier Li Keqiang has suddenly died less than a year after stepping down from overseeing the world’s second-largest economy.

title: Influential Sultan to Take Malaysia Throne as Royals Gain Power
description: Malaysia is poised to choose the Sultan of Johor as its next king, a role that’s become increasingly important in determining who takes power in the Southeast Asian nation.
